title: ‚ÄòBihar-Bidi‚Äô row: Kerala Cong admits 'mistake'; social media head meets leaders
content: A controversy erupted after Kerala Congress's social media post compared Bihar to a 'bidi', drawing criticism from the BJP and upsetting ally RJD. The post, a dig at GST rates, was deleted, and an apology was issued. Union Minister Chirag Paswan condemned the remark as defaming the people of Bihar, reflecting Congress's mindset. V.T.

title: 'Need better oppn': FM's jab at Cong over 'ill-informed' criticism of GST 2.0
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has strongly criticized the opposition, accusing them of misleading the public regarding GST reforms. She asserted that the initial GST structure was a collective decision by the Empowered Committee, including Congress members. Sitharaman dismissed claims that PM Modi undermined the GST Council and emphasized his commitment to pro-people reforms.

title: Trump vs Pichai: US judge wants lawsuit settled; says lawyers failed to offer plan
content: Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers is pushing for a resolution in Donald Trump's lawsuit against YouTube and its CEO, Sundar Pichai, regarding his account suspension after the Capitol riot. After private negotiations stalled, the judge has ordered a public update by September 29 and scheduled a videoconference for October 6 to discuss a plan for resolving the case.

title: Gold surges to record high: October futures hit Rs 1.07 lakh on MCX ‚Äî time to invest?
content: Gold futures have surged to a record high of Rs 1,07,807 per 10 grams on the MCX, driven by global economic uncertainty and central bank purchases. Anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts and ongoing tariff concerns are fueling safe-haven demand. Analysts remain optimistic, noting key support levels that could lead to further gains.

title: Mallya, Nirav Modi & others to be extradited soon? UK team inspects Tihar jail
content: A British team recently visited Tihar Jail in New Delhi. This inspection is part of India's effort to bring back fugitives from the UK. The team assessed conditions for individuals like Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi. India assured safe housing and fair treatment. Extradition requests are pending, including those of arms dealers. India emphasizes humane conditions in its jails.

title: 'Wanted to settle score': Why Noida man sent fake bomb threat; cops reveal details
content: A Noida resident, Ashwani Kumar, has been apprehended for sending a false threat to Mumbai Police, claiming 14 terrorists entered the city with explosives. Kumar, posing as an astrologer, aimed to frame a friend who had previously filed a case against him, leading to his imprisonment. The hoax message triggered a high alert in Mumbai ahead of Anant Chaturthi celebrations.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: After Xavier Worthy injury, Chiefs could sign Super Bowl champion WR eying offense
content: Xavier Worthy's early injury in the Chiefs' opening game against the Chargers has cast a shadow over their season start. The rookie receiver's collision with Travis Kelce raises concerns about the team's receiving depth. With Worthy's availability uncertain, speculation arises about potential replacements, including veteran Odell Beckham Jr., who was present at the game.

title: India A squad vs Australia A: Shreyas Iyer named captain
content: Shreyas Iyer will captain the 15-member India A squad against Australia A in Lucknow, with Dhruv Jurel as vice-captain. The series starts September 16. KL Rahul and Mohammed Siraj will join the squad for the second match beginning September 23.

title: Manny Pacquiao net worth in 2025: Breaking down his boxing, endorsements, politics income
content: Manny Pacquiao, by 2025, amassed a $220 million fortune through boxing, endorsements, and strategic business ventures. His boxing career, highlighted by a $575 million earning and a lucrative Mayweather fight, significantly fueled his wealth. Endorsements with major brands like Nike and ventures such as Manny Pacquiao Promotions further amplified his financial success.

title: Meta‚Äôs brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg‚Äôs own words
content: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.

title: ‚ÄòGST mein kuch kaam kariye‚Äô: FM recalls PM Modi‚Äôs words; focus was on ensuring ease of compliance
content: GST rates have been rationalized on numerous items, significantly reducing the number of slabs and altering procedures. The Finance Minister emphasized a user-centric approach, considering daily use, aspirations, and the needs of farmers and MSMEs. These changes aim to ease compliance, boost consumption, and foster economic growth, while addressing concerns from states and exporters.

title: BCCI to hold AGM on Sept 28 to elect president, secretary, other office bearers
content: The BCCI's 94th Annual General Meeting is scheduled for September 28, 2025, in Mumbai, where key decisions will be made. The election of new office bearers, including President and Secretary, will be a primary focus, alongside financial reviews and committee appointments. The formation of the Women's Premier League Committee and discussions on sexual harassment prevention highlight the meeting's comprehensive agenda.

title: Golden kalash worth Rs 1.5 cr stolen from fest at Red Fort; FIR filed
content: A one kg gold kalash was stolen. The incident happened during a Jain Samaj festival near Red Fort. The festival was held at 15 August Park. Police received a complaint on September 3. Kotwali police station registered a case. The case is under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Section 303(2).

title: Will Trump block IT outsourcing to India? Aide says, 'Make call centers American again!'
content: Amid trade tensions as MAGA is increasing the pressure on the administration to stop programs that generate jobs in India, right-wing commentator Laura Loomer claimed Trump is considering blocking IT outsourcing to India. "Make Call Centers American Again!" Loomer posted on X. Loomer is not in administration or a policymaker but has gained prominence as Trump whisperer.

title: India A squad vs Australia A: Who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out from the England tour ‚Äì complete details
content: Shreyas Iyer will captain India A against Australia A in Lucknow, joined by KL Rahul and Mohammed Siraj for the second match. Several new faces, including N Jagadeesan and Ayush Badoni, have been included after strong domestic performances.

title: 'Slapped 50‚Äì60 times': Student assaulted inside pvt univ; 5 named in FIR
content: In Lucknow's Chinhat, a law student was allegedly assaulted and threatened by a group of fellow students inside his university campus. The victim, Shikhar, was attacked in a car, enduring physical abuse and intimidation. An FIR has been lodged, and police are investigating the incident, which has left the student traumatized and fearing for his safety.

title: Fears being too controlling: Abhay Deol opens up about fatherhood
content: Abhay Deol recently engaged in a candid conversation with Dr Jai Madaan during his signature analysis, where the subject of marriage and children naturally came up. Known for his unconventional views, the actor did not shy away from admitting that parenthood isn‚Äôt part of his life plan.

title: Himachal Pradesh landslide: Massive section of hill collapses near Chaukar village ‚Äî watch
content: A massive landslide near Chaukar village in Sirmaur's Nauhradhar area caused a 200-meter section of hill to collapse, threatening nearby homes. While five people present at the site are safe, five houses now fall within the danger zone due to heavy monsoon rains causing soil erosion. Authorities are monitoring the area and urging vigilance.

title: Asia Cup : BCCI breaks silence on criticism over India facing Pak - 'We're following govt's policy'
content: Amid criticism over India facing Pakistan in the Asia Cup, BCCI clarifies its stance. The board cites government policy allowing participation in multinational events. This policy applies even to nations with strained relations. Boycotting such tournaments could lead to sanctions. These sanctions would affect Indian sports federations and athletes like Neeraj Chopra.

title: ‚ÄòThreatening‚Äô IPS officer row: Ajit Pawar says he respects women cops; FIR filed against 4
content: Following accusations of threatening an IPS officer, a case was filed against four individuals in Solapur for obstructing officials during an anti-illegal sand mining operation. Ajit Pawar clarified his intent was to maintain peace, not interfere with law enforcement. Opposition parties demand Pawar be named in the FIR, alleging obstruction of duty, while his nephew defends his communication style.

title: 'Who drafted Ajit Pawar's X post?': Priyanka Chaturvedi hits out at deputy CM over viral video
content: Priyanka Chaturvedi questioned Ajit Pawar's commitment to respecting women officers. This follows Amol Mitkari's actions. Mitkari sought verification of an IPS officer's documents. A video showed Pawar allegedly threatening the same officer. Pawar denied the threats and affirmed his respect for the police. He promised action against illegal sand mining.

title: 'Not just bananas, snatching funds too': MP monkeys raid temples, villages
content: In Madhya Pradesh, the forest department's decision to stop funding monkey capture, due to the removal of rhesus macaques from the Wildlife Protection Act, has shifted the responsibility to local bodies.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs Tesla pay plan: $1 trillion package for milestone
content: Elon Musk could become the world's first trillionaire under a new Tesla pay plan tied to ambitious performance goals. The plan, requiring up to a 10-year commitment, hinges on Tesla achieving unprecedented targets in market capitalization, vehicle deliveries, and robotics deployment. Shareholder approval is needed for this historic compensation package.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder case: SIT files 790-page chargesheet; Sonam, lover Raj among 5 accused
content: Meghalaya Police's SIT has filed a chargesheet in the Raja Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder case, implicating his wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, her lover, Raj Singh Kushwaha, and three accomplices. The Indore-based businessman was murdered at a gorge in Sohra, with Sonam present during the crime.

title: Delhi stabbing: Schoolboy reaches police station with knife lodged in chest; 3 minors held
content: In central Delhi's Paharganj, three minors were apprehended for allegedly stabbing a 15-year-old boy outside his school. The victim arrived at the police station with a knife in his chest and was promptly hospitalized. The attack was motivated by revenge, as one of the accused believed the victim instigated a prior assault on him.

title: ‚ÄòPolitically motivated violence‚Äô: Khalistani groups receive funds from Canada; report raises red flags
content: A Canadian Department of Finance report reveals that Khalistani extremist groups, along with Hamas and Hezbollah, receive financial support from Canada. These groups exploit charities and non-profit organizations to fund politically motivated violence. Canadian intelligence confirms that Khalistani extremists use Canada as a base for fundraising and planning violence in India, raising concerns about the impact on relations with India.

title: Amritsar temple grenade attack: NIA nabs key accused in Bihar; arms, funds came from abroad
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested Sharanjit Kumar, a key suspect in the Thakurdwara temple grenade attack in Amritsar, from Gaya, Bihar. He is accused of being actively involved in the conspiracy and execution of the terror attack.

title: ‚ÄòFully reciprocate sentiments‚Äô: PM Modi reacts to Trump's stance on India-US ties amid tariff row
content: Amid strained bilateral ties due to Washington's tariffs, PM Modi responded to President Trump's praise, reciprocating his sentiments and highlighting the positive strategic partnership between India and the US. Trump expressed disappointment over India's oil trade with Russia and defended the imposed tariffs, despite affirming his friendship with PM Modi and acknowledging the special relationship between the two nations.

title: Mumbai scare: Man who sent 'human bombs, RDX' terror threat arrested; cops traced sim
content: Crime Branch have arrested Ashwin Kumar Supra from Noida for allegedly sending bomb threat messages to the Mumbai Traffic Police's WhatsApp helpline. The threat claimed 14 terrorists had entered the city with explosives. The message, identifying the sender as 'Lashkar-e-Jihadi,' prompted a thorough investigation involving multiple agencies.

title: Who is Madison Beer? Rumored girlfriend of Justin Herbert
content: Justin Herbert led the Los Angeles Chargers to a thrilling victory over the Kansas City Chiefs, sparking rumors about his relationship with pop star Madison Beer. Fans playfully attributed Herbert's stellar performance to the "Madison Beer effect," blending sports and celebrity intrigue. As the Chargers prepare to face the Raiders, attention remains on both Herbert's performance and Beer's potential influence.

title: Health emergency: 'Mysterious illness' kills 20 in Andhra village; spread via water
content: Andhra Pradesh government addresses a health crisis in Turakapalem. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu orders a health emergency after numerous deaths. Health camps are planned, and experts will investigate the cause. Protected drinking water will be supplied. A committee is formed to investigate reporting failures. Health Minister Y Satya Kumar Yadav assures action against negligent officials.

title: Women's World Cup: Pak to skip opening ceremony in Guwahati; clash with India on Oct 5
content: Pakistan's women's cricket team will not attend the ICC Women's World Cup opening ceremony in India, aligning with a recent agreement between the two nations to avoid cross-border travel for ICC tournaments. Political tensions continue to impact sporting relations, as evidenced by India's previous decision to skip the Champions Trophy in Pakistan.

title: 'Gukesh will lose his title': Anand slams Uzbek GM - Watch
content: Uzbekistan's Nodirbek Abdusattorov has stirred the chess world by predicting that India's youngest world champion, D Gukesh, will lose his title in the next defense. Viswanathan Anand responded with amusement, acknowledging the comment's entertainment value. Gukesh, unfazed, focused on the Candidates Tournament qualification race, where Abdusattorov is a contender alongside other strong players.

title: SIIMA 2025: Allu Arjun bags top honor for ‚ÄòPushpa 2‚Äô
content: At SIIMA 2025 in Dubai, Telugu films 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and 'Kalki 2898 AD' won major awards. Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna received top acting honors. Kannada films like Gowri also won. Malayalam and Tamil winners will be announced Saturday, led by The Goat Life with 10 nominations.

title: Swifties brace for takeover: Taylor Swift in Super Bowl?
content: Speculation is rife that Taylor Swift might headline the next Super Bowl halftime show, with negotiations reportedly underway. Fans have spotted potential Easter eggs in her recent podcast appearance, linking her to the event. While the NFL is eager to have her, Swift is in no rush, possibly waiting for a time when Travis Kelce can fully enjoy the experience.

title: Rise and Fall contestants: From Pawan Singh to Arjun Bijlani, who‚Äôs joining the show?
content: The highly anticipated reality show 'Rise and Fall' features a diverse cast including TV stars like Arjun Bijlani, who will be a contestant, and hosted by Ashneer Grover. The show includes personalities like dancer Dhanashree Verma, comedian Kiku Sharda, and singer Aditya Narayan.

title: Uttarakhand: Students take Rs 10k chopper ride to exam hall; cover 280km in 30 mins
content: Due to landslides blocking road access to Munsyari in Pithoragarh, four BEd students from Rajasthan chartered a helicopter from Haldwani to ensure they could take their examination.

title: Ken Dryden dies at 78: Hall of fame goalie battled with cancer
content: Ken Dryden, the Montreal Canadiens' legendary goalie, has died at 78 after battling cancer. A Hockey Hall of Famer, he led the Canadiens to six Stanley Cups in the 1970s. Dryden's career included success at Cornell, a pivotal role in the 1972 Summit Series, and later, achievements as a broadcaster, politician, and author, leaving an enduring legacy on the sport.

title: West Bengal man thrashed in Odisha: Mob brands him Bangladeshi; breaks hand for ‚Äòspeaking Bengali‚Äô
content: Tarzan Sheikh, a migrant worker from Katwa, alleged he was assaulted in Odisha for being a "Bengali-speaking Bangladeshi." Sheikh, who has been working as a hawker in Jaleshwar for five years, was reportedly attacked near Lakshmandihi area after speaking in Bengali. The mob allegedly stole Rs 6,000 and fractured his arm, branding his documents as forged.

title: Asia Cup mode on! Pics out from India‚Äôs first training; Hardik's hairstyle in focus
content: India's cricket team concluded their Dubai practice, gearing up to defend their Asia Cup title. Key players like Gill and Yadav participated in batting sessions, while Bumrah rejoined after a break. The team, under coach Gambhir, is set to face UAE, Pakistan, and Oman in Group A, aiming to continue their Asia Cup dominance.

title: Mid-air scare: Abu Dhabi-bound IndiGo flight suffers tech snag; returns to Kochi
content: An IndiGo flight, 6E-1403, en route from Kochi to Abu Dhabi with over 180 passengers, had to make an unscheduled return to Kochi early Saturday morning. The A320 neo aircraft experienced a technical issue mid-air after flying for over two hours, prompting the diversion.

title: UNGA session: PM Modi likely to skip this year amid tariff row; Jaishankar to represent India
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to represent India at the upcoming UN General Assembly in New York. While a slot was reserved for PM Modi, his participation remains uncertain. Sources suggest a meeting with President Trump is unlikely due to ongoing trade talks and recent diplomatic tensions.

title: Herbert shines as Chargers earn AFC West win over Chiefs in Brazil
content: The Chargers held on to win at Corinthians Arena in S√£o Paulo in a potentially critical AFC West battle.

title: Dryden, who helped Habs to six Cups, dies at 78
content: Ken Dryden, the Hall of Fame goaltender who helped the Canadiens win six Stanley Cup titles in the 1970s, has died at age 78.

title: Sky suspend Reese for 'detrimental' comments
content: Angel Reese was suspended by the Chicago Sky for the first half of Sunday's matchup against the Las Vegas Aces for comments she made that were "detrimental to the team."

title: Harbaugh touts Herbert as Bolts finally beat K.C.
content: Justin Herbert passed for 318 yards and three touchdowns and reeled off a game-clinching third-down scramble as the Chargers ended a seven-game losing streak to the Chiefs.

title: Commission overstated OK'd NIL deals by $44.4M
content: The College Sports Commission sent a correction, saying it had overstated the amount of name, image, likeness deals it has cleared by more than $40 million in a data set it had previously made public.

title: Alcaraz's level 'just too good,' concedes Djokovic
content: Shortly after his 6-4, 7-6 (4), 6-2 loss to Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open semifinals, Novak Djokovic admitted to reporters it would be a challenge for him to defeat Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner in future majors.

title: OKC rookie Sorber out for season with torn ACL
content: Thunder rookie big man Thomas Sorber tore the ACL in his right knee and will miss the 2025-26 season, the team announced.

title: Angels prospect in critical condition after car crash
content: Angels minor leaguer Rio Foster, who plays for the High-A Tri-City Dust Devils in Pasco, Washington, was involved in a car accident early Friday morning and was in critical condition.

title: Young fan meets Bader after HR ball taken away
content: The Philadelphia Phillies invited a young fan to meet center fielder Harrison Bader after a home run ball dispute during their 9-3 win over the Miami Marlins on Friday night.

title: üèà The Playbook: Week 1 fantasy football guide
content: Mike Clay's Playbook now includes Shadow Reports, providing an all-encompassing look at Week 1's matchups to exploit and avoid in fantasy.

content: Get set for two big brands trying to look the part in a unique helmet game, some big tests for Big Ten hopefuls and the Group of 5's biggest weekend.

content: Could Jahmyr Gibbs have a huge receiving game? Will the Bengals finally win in Week 1? Which two Jaguars should you add in your fantasy leagues?

title: Sabalenka vs. Anisimova: Who will win the US Open title?
content: No. 1 Sabalenka will take on No. 8 Anisimova in the US Open final Saturday. Who will prevail? It's not as straightforward as it seems on paper.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

content: A head coach at 37 and a former QB himself, Kellen Moore aims to get New Orleans back to the postseason.

title: Bills' 2022 draft class intends to make its mark as a new core in Buffalo.
content: A new core group rallies around QB Josh Allen as Buffalo seeks to continue its success for years to come.

content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Inside the Micah Parsons trade
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: ü§Ø CFB overreactions: Belichick, Arch, more
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: üèÄ Report: Clips skirted cap with Kawhi payment
content: The Clippers reportedly have been accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap by paying $28 million to Kawhi Leonard for a "no-show job."

title: üí∞ Gundy, Lanning trade barbs over Ducks' budget
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

title: üèÄ Caitlin Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs eye big January for Villa's Morgan Rogers
content: Aston Villa midfielder Morgan Rogers could be a January target for Tottenham Hotspur. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: The women's summer transfer window broke records and had some incredible moves. What were some of the best?

title: James Madison's icy white look headlines best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: James Madison will look to make a statement on the road against Louisville wearing a slick all-white look.

title: Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: Rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: Top prospects at every position
content: Who are the best players at every position? Our analysts give their top-fives, plus their combined overall top-10 ranking for the 2026 class.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Watch: Ajit Pawar Plays Dhol During Ganpati Visarjan
content: Joining crores of revellers across the state, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar played the dhol as Ganesh immersion processions began in Pune.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Madhya Pradesh Government Labs Under Scanner Over "Wrong" Test Reports
content: On a humid morning in Bhopal's JP District Hospital, a young mother named Sangeeta sat anxiously outside the pathology lab, clutching the frail hand of her six-year-old son

title: Kerala Man, 41, Dies After Being Stabbed By Wife's Live-In Partner: Cops
content: A 41-year-old man was stabbed to death allegedly by his wife's live-in partner at Naduvathoor in this south Kerala district, police said on Saturday.

title: Man Rapes Minor, Strangles Her In Maharashtra. She Had Denied Sex
content: A man in Maharashtra's Palghar raped and killed his fiancee, a minor girl, after she refused to have physical relations with him.

title: Astrologer Vs Astrologer: Court Orders Removal Of Videos Alleging Black Magic
content: The Delhi High Court has directed astrologer Umang Taneja to take down defamatory videos and photos of another astrologer, Trishla Chaturvedi.

title: Rs 12,000 Crore Drug Racket Busted In Telangana, IT Expert Among 12 Arrested
content: A huge drug manufacturing syndicate operating in Telangana was busted by the Mira Road Police of Maharashtra's Thane district on Saturday, with the officials seizing MD (mephedrone) drugs worth Rs 12,000 crore.

title: Neighbours Lynched After Child Found Dead In Bengal's Nadia
content: The body of a child was found in Nischintapur area in West Bengal's Nadia district on Saturday morning, following which a mob lynched a couple for allegedly being involved in the minor's death, police said.

title: "Why Have Emblem At Religious Place?" Omar Abdullah On Hazratbal Vandalism
content: The national emblem should not have been used at a religious place, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has said, a day after angry devotees defiled the emblem on a plaque placed outside the main prayer room of the Hazratbal shrine in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Lucknow Amity Student Slapped '50-60 Times' On Campus, Video Viral
content: A second-year law student of Amity University in Lucknow was allegedly slapped "50-60 times" by his classmates inside a vehicle at the varsity's parking lot last month.

title: Stabbed Outside School, Delhi Boy Reaches Police Station With Knife In Chest
content: Three minors have been apprehended for allegedly stabbing a 15-year-old boy outside his school in central Delhi's Paharganj area, police said on Saturday.

title: "Unmarked Kashmir Graves Claim Is Propaganda, Fabricated Narrative": Study
content: For decades, separatist groups and their backers across the border in Pakistan have wielded the narrative of "unmarked graves" in Kashmir as proof of alleged atrocities by Indian security forces. A recent study cuts through the fog of propaganda.

title: "Don't Think US Top Court Will Do Much": Abhijit Banerjee To NDTV On Legal Fight Over Tariffs
content: Abhijit Banerjee highlights the challenges and uncertainties in India-US relations amid Donald Trump‚Äôs tariffs, while advising cautious diplomacy and open communication.

title: "India Will Eat A Roti Less But Never Succumb": Manish Tewari On Trump's 'Lost India' Remark
content: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Saturday responded to US President Donald Trump's remarks, "lost Russia and India to deepest, darkest China," saying that the issue is not about tariffs but about "self-respect, dignity, and honour."

title: Donald Trump Exempts Gold, Uranium, Other Metals From Global Tariffs
content: Donald Trump moved Friday to exempt graphite, tungsten, uranium, gold bullion and other metals from his country-based tariffs, while subjecting silicone products to the levies.

title: Adani Power, Druk Green Power To Set Up 570 MW Hydro Power Project In Bhutan
content: Adani Power, India's largest private power producer, and Druk Green Power Corp. Ltd. (DGPC), Bhutan's state-owned generation utility, signed the Shareholders Agreement (SHA) for setting up a 570 MW Wangchu hydroelectric project in Bhutan

title: "Nude Gang" Panic Among Women In UP's Meerut, Drones Used For Surveillance
content: They arrive naked and drag women to deserted areas. A fourth such attempt has been reported from Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, allegedly by what is being referred to as a 'nude gang', spreading panic among women in Daurala.

title: 'Alcoholic' Husband Killed, Buried In House By Wife In Jharkhand
content: A middle-aged tribal woman allegedly murdered her 'alcoholic' husband after a heated argument and buried the body inside the house for over 10 days in Jharkhand's Dhanbad district, police said on Saturday.

title: "A Message Of Victory": Trump On Renaming Pentagon To Department Of War
content: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order renaming the Department of Defense as the "Department of War", reviving a title last used in the 1940s.

title: US Man Kills Girlfriend, Dog, Then Video Calls His Ex-Girlfriend: "I Did It"
content: The accused, identified as 29-year-old Taton Dorfman, has been charged with second-degree murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.

title: Skilled students will find jobs despite IT slowdown: JNTU-GV in-charge Vice-Chancellor
content: Affiliated colleges have been directed to upgrade infrastructure and launch industry-oriented courses to enhance employability, she says

title: No deal on agricultural imports with U.S. at the cost of Indian farmers: Chouhan
content: The Prime Minister has said no pact will take place at the cost of farmers. Their interest will be protected, says Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan

title: BJP to launch nationwide public awareness drive on rationalisation of GST rates
content: The GST reform would lead to an increase in demand across all sectors, also leading to growth in manufacturing and, therefore, jobs, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: Museum of Letters in Kottayam set for ‚Çπ15-crore expansion
content: Administrative sanction granted for second, third, and fourth phases of the facility. The first phase was inaugurated in November last year

title: Buzz around GI tagging in Assam‚Äôs poll-bound Bodoland
content: The registration of 21 items so far has enthused 26 communities of the Bodoland Territorial Region to have their cultural artefacts GI-tagged

title: NTRUHS to organize 27th and 28th convocations on September 9
content: CEO and Chief Cardiac Surgeon of the National Heart Institute, New Delhi O.P. Yadava, has been chosen for the award of the Honorary Degree of Doctor of Sciences (Honoris Causa)¬†

title: ED attaches assets worth ‚Çπ30-crore in ‚Äòillegal mining‚Äô case
content: The ED‚Äôs probe is based on a case registered by the Haryana Police alleging illegal mining of sand, boulder-gravel and boulder-gravel-sand in Yamuna Nagar against various mining lease holder companies and others

title: New helpline to aid rescue of stranded marine animals along Tamil Nadu coast
content: A marine animal stranding occurs when an animal washes ashore and is unable to return to the sea due to injury, illness, or disorientation¬†

title: Will National Anti-profiteering Authority now have fresh lease of life: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: "On September 30, 2024, Modi government issued a notification virtually abolishing the NAA with effect from April 1, 2025," he said in a post on X

title: Officials arrange check posts to prevent smuggling of fertilizers
content: Superintendent of Police K. Pratap Shiva Kishore checked fertilizer godowns in Eluru district, verifies records

title: Chief Ministers directs officials to declare health emergency in Turakapalem after mysterious deaths
content: Preliminary findings point to the possible spread of Melioidosis, a bacterial infection, as the cause of the deaths, and blood samples have been sent to laboratories for confirmation, with reports expected within three days, the officials told the Chief Minister

title: Tension over erection of Kapu leader Vangaveeti Ranga statue at flyover in Kakinada City
content: The police, civic body authorities prevented locals from erecting statue of the Kapu leader at the flyover while the Rotary Club was preparing to erect their plaque

title: Court allows jailed J&K MP Engineer Rashid to vote in V-P election on September¬†9
content: Earlier, he was granted custody parole between July 24 and August 4 to attend the monsoon session of Parliament

title: Andhra Pradesh Grandhalaya Parishad gets ‚Çπ3 crore Central funds to develop libraries in the State
content: The State Library Planning Committee decided to utilise the funds for development of Sri Gowtami Regional Library, Rajamahendravaram and Regional Libraries at Guntur, Kurnool and Visakhapatnam

title: Governor‚Äôs discretion in premature release of convicts: Madras High Court refers issue to larger bench
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan refer the matter to a larger Bench due to conflicting decisions taken by two other Division Benches

title: Home births in Kerala‚Äôs Malappuram drop sharply to 6 a month
content: Efforts by health officials have led to a substantial decline in home births among the tribespeople in the district‚Äôs remote areas of Nilambur, where such cases were once common

title: Case against student activists for organising pro-Palestine protest at Madayipara in Kerala‚Äôs Kannur
content: A complaint alleges that protesters carried flags and banners allegedly causing damage to biodiversity of the biological ecological zone, said a complaint

title: GST overhaul: Nirmala Sitharaman writes to State Finance Ministers, thanks them
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said States made their view on the proposal to rejig tax rates but ultimately agreed that it was for the benefit of the common man, an argument that helped reach a unanimous decision at the GST Council meeting

title: 'Kalash' worth ‚Çπ1 crore stolen from religious ceremony in Delhi
content: The vessel was embedded with 150 grams diamonds, rubies, and emeralds, and was stolen from the ceremony on September 3, says an official.

title: Sengottaiyan: Ups and downs in the career of a long-standing AIADMK loyalist
content: A nine-time legislator, the 77-year-old leader was first elected from the Sathyamangalam Assembly constituency in 1977 when the AIADMK captured power for the first time

title: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah criticises use of national emblem on renovation plaque at Hazratbal mosque
content: A major controversy that erupted after the plaque bearing the Ashoka emblem was placed inside the revered Hazratbal shrine and vandalised by unidentified people shortly after prayers on September 5

title: Kerala‚Äôs infant mortality rate falls to all-time low of 5
content: An IMR of 5 is an incredible achievement for Kerala‚Äôs health system, as it is even lower than the current infant mortality rate of 5.6 in United States

title: Bhagwant Mann is currently fine: Punjab Minister Harpal Cheema
content: The Minister said that the Chief Minister is doing better and is advised to stay in the hospital for two to three days

title: Lieutenant Parul Dhadwal commissioned into Indian Army Ordnance Corps
content: Lt Parul Dhadwal represents the fifth generation of her family in uniform, hailing from Village Janauri, District Hoshiarpur, Punjab, a region renowned for its strong martial tradition

title: Will continue efforts to strengthen AIADMK, says Sengottaiyan after removal from key posts
content: Mr. Sengottaiyan, who held the positions of organisation secretary and secretary of the Erode Suburban (West) district unit, was removed from both posts on Saturday

title: Air Marshal Philip Rajkumar (retd.) remembers 60 Years of the Sargodha (Pakistan) strike
content: At 84, Air Marshal Rajkumar remains active, serving earlier as President of the Aeronautical Society of India and continuing to pursue his passion as an avid golfer

content: In a Facebook post, the commission describes social media posts that claim that the public has time till October to add their names to voters‚Äô lists as ‚Äòfake‚Äô

title: Hyderabad‚Äôs gigantic Khairatabad Ganesh idol immersed amidst devotion and spiritual chants
content: The Khairtabad Ganesh idol is 69-ft tall. To put the size of the idol in perspective, the granite Buddha statue in the middle of the Hussainsagar lake is 58-ft tall.

title: Two killed as dilapidated house collapses owing to rain in Jaipur

content: In a collective appeal signed by more than 100 members, they said democratic institutions in the country have come under severe strain in the past decade

title: Hazratbal plaque row: BJP vows action, J&K CM questions national emblem at shrine
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Sengottaiyan removed as AIADMK organisation secretary, Erode Suburban (West) district secretary: Palaniswami

M. Soundariya Preetha reports on how America‚Äôs tariffs have upended operations in the apparel hubs of Tiruppur and Karur in Tamil Nadu, a major garment-exporting State
